However, in Lean Hogs, speculative bullishness is met with growing commercial hedging pressure [CITE: Lean Hogs], and these reports do not provide the real-time technical data needed for direct trading signals for a 1-5 day execution horizon.

Avoid

State of the Market

The COT report for Major Currencies reveals a mixed sentiment. While the Brazilian Real shows extreme speculative bullishness, currencies like Japanese Yen and EURO FX are experiencing eroding or softening bullish conviction [CITE: Executive Summary]. Swiss Franc has a "squeeze setup" active [CITE: Swiss Franc]. This divergence and lack of consistent bullish bias across the board, coupled with the nature of COT data, makes new long positions for the 1-5 day horizon unsuitable. Avoid

State of the Market

The COT report for VIX Futures indicates non-commercial traders are reducing their net-short exposure (-101,689 contracts, reduced by 6,121 WoW) [CITE: Speculators], while commercial hedgers are also trimming their net-longs. Positioning is not extreme (COT Index 41.85) [CITE: COT Index], suggesting a lack of strong conviction for a significant directional move in volatility [CITE: Implication].
